text: I don't understand the changing of tyre colours. It is supposed to make it easier to determine the which tyre is used, but now with testing there are so many mixed colours, that I have no idea which tyre is which!
author: LegendaryAiden

text:
For Testing: C1 - C2 - C3 - C4 - C5
C1 = Hardest tyre compound - White/No band around the tyre wall
C2 = Hard tyre compound - White/Band around the tyre wall. 
C3 = Medium/Soft tyre compound - Yellow/Band around the tyre wall.
C4 = Softer tyre compound - Red/Band around the tyre wall.
C5 = Softest tyre compound - Red/No band around the tyre wall.
There's also a black development tyre with no markings being trialed during testing too.

Once the F1 season kicks off in Melbourne: Pirelli will bring three of those five compounds to each race and name them Hard, Medium and Soft, regardless of what C spec they actually are. So, theoretically it will be much easier for F1 followers to know which tyres each driver/team is using.
author: GMC

text: @GMC this is incredibly helpful, thanks a lot!
author: LegendaryAiden

text:
@LegendaryAiden You're welcome, friend.
For the most part, teams have been running on the C2 or C3 in testing. Only a few of the teams have tried the C4 and C5 yet, I believe.

text:
Man Charles is gonna be good! After I watched a hand full of races of his in the junior categories I was convinced...The kid oozes greatness but unlike Max he possesses an uncanny calm and maturity...
Gotta have both types of personalities which will keep the future of F1 interesting...
They both are off the charts talented! 
"IF" the Ferrari is equal or better than the Mercedes, it is going to be an exciting season and Vettel better learn to keep his shit together because Charles WILL get the better of him @ the very least on a hand full of occassions. I personally think Vettel will crack..He has always had that problem where he (IN MY OPINION) all the way back into his Red Bull days puts way to much pressure on himself wth a mix of lack of confidence mixed with over confidence used with spoiled, mixed with raw emotion mixed with an undoubtable talent which forces mistakes. Prime example of all of that confusion together CANADA 2011 where last lap he had it in the bag and blew it for Jenson Button to have the craziest win in F1 history..He cracked in really a meaningless race in terms of the driver championship, wasnt a championship decider or anything. 
I don't think Seb will be able to have the protection from Leclerc as he did with Webber where Vettel could do whatever he wanted.
If Charles starts / is allowed to race early on Vettel will undoubtedly crack..It isn't gonna be Lewis in a different team it will come from within and I don't think Ferrari will put up with the temper tantrums come contract renewal if Leclerc is showing he can consistanly challange Lewis, Max, vettel...

text:
Testing tells us nothing though. Can't wait for the real season to start. I really wonder how Charles will do. Every team and driver has an interesting story this season.


How will Vettel pick himself up after last season and the teamboss change + having a rookie team-mate now. Will the Ferrari deliver? Will Vettel beat Hamilton?
How will Leclerc do as a rookie in a new top team? Will be out-qualify the veteran? Will he be able to challenge Vettel a bit?


How will Hamilton perform this season. Is he still hungry? I bet he is. Will Mercedes still be able to deliver? I bet they will. And Bottas? How will his beard fare against Hamilton?


What about Verstappen? Will Honda deliver? Will the Renault badmouthing come back and bite him in the ass? What about Gasly? Will he be able to compete with Verstappen? 


What about Kimi in an Afla? What about all the new drivers? What about Kubica? What about Williams? Yikes? What about Renault and Ricciardo? What about Ricciardo vs. Hulkenberg? What about Grosjean? Will he be able to keep calm this season? What about Magnussen? Who will he drive off the track this season?

author: mstrchf 123

text:
mstrchf 123 Vettel has been very disappointing for the last three years.
Leclerc has done an amazing job in the GP2, his last year was impressive to. He is almost equally quick by the tests. Although Vettel will be a bit faster at the beginning, I think Leclerc is the faster one.
Vettel is very vulnerable when the pressure is too high.
He will be more under pressure than last year.
author: #60 Legends

text:
@#60 Legends Charles has pressure too this year. How is he going to handle that? We don't know. How is he gonna react when Vettel is often 0.3 faster in Q3. Seb gets pole, 0.3 slower you might be 4th on the grid. The whole race is different/difficult. The Ferrari might very well be the best car this year but if you qualify 4th you're in the mix with Verstappen, Hamilton etc...and might not get any places back. These people might own you even bringing more pressure. 

 + every race you get this. Good car, underperforming...teammate better in qualifying therefore the race, there might be some crashes. Now you have to 'keep it clean' and go faster. 

At sauber people don't even see you were 0.3 slower in Q than optimal. who cares....still 4tenths faster than your average teammate. At Ferrari all the above things bring more pressure. 

In short i think it's a tough year for charles leclerc and vettel isnt that bothered. I actually don't think vettel is that sensitive to pressure. His style always been agressive, bordering stupid sometimes. But if you're close to the wdc you lose it at those moments. 

I bet you can go back through the years for vettel and find the same kind of reckless incidents in every season.  I see that more as Vettel not giving a fuck. Also a luxury that leclerc doesn't have.
author: mstrchf 123

text:
mstrchf 123 Dude, you forget that Vettel tries to be world champion at Ferrari for 3 years.
Sure, you can not say how Leclerc will beat, but this guy need to Win.
Vettel is too vulnerable, that‚Äôs all what I say and that‚Äôs enough to fail.
He became a four-time World Champion because RedBull was on another planet at this time.
His new team-mate by Ferrari does not make things easier.
They will not tell him to let Vettel pass, like Kimi.
No matter if you have the fastest car, the Enemies will be too strong.
